is complemented by ample opportunities for fieldwork, internships, and career preparation.
rather, a classroom experience that pairs an average class size of 12 with a world-renowned faculty ranked #1 by The Princeton Review (2020)

Alumnus Dr. Ian Lipkin â74 was recently celebrated for his leadership in helping China confront the global SARS outbreak in the early â00s. His pioneering career in pathogen discovery has led industry-changing methods to search for and identify viruses. In 1999, he led a team that identified the first cases of West Nile virus in the Western Hemisphere, which he found to be the cause of an outbreak of encephalitis in NYC. As a student at
, he first began to consider medicine and science as a path for himself, and has used his talents and career to contribute to bettering the world. . . .

Support the Sarah Lawrence community, and ensure the College continues its forward momentum. Give a gift that has a direct impact on our students, faculty, and campus.
There are many ways to give, from making a
to establishing an endowed fund. Whatever you choose, your gift will help the College continue to educate intellectually rigorous, creative thinkers and doers who go on to change the world.
All gifts to Sarah Lawrence College are significant, and there are many ways to make a donation—and a difference.

maps out a vision that will ensure the College continues its forward momentum: educating intellectually rigorous, creative thinkers and doers who are singularly prepared to tackle the world. With your participation, we will realize this vision.

Planned gifts provide donors with a number of ways to maximize their financial support for the College while earning income or tax benefits. From bequests to gift annuities,

help ensure the future of Sarah Lawrence College by providing a stable source of income in perpetuity. Donors of endowed funds play a crucial role in sustaining the College’s unique educational model and extraordinary experiences.
The Young Alumni Community provides one of the best opportunities for recent graduates to stay involved with the College. The group also offers key fundraising, event, and admission support.
about how you can get involved.

Reunion is a time to reflect on the Sarah Lawrence experience, celebrate with classmates, and reconnect with the College. It’s also an opportunity to begin, renew, or increase your giving to Sarah Lawrence.
Foundation, government, and corporate support helps fuel new program initiatives and secure scholarships for students and funds for faculty.
Donors are connected by an important thread: they hold Sarah Lawrence close to their hearts, and maintain a strong connection to the College through giving.

Friends of Sarah Lawrence College Three-Day Mini-Course: Relating in the Digital Age
This free mini-course is open to Friends of the College only; learn more about and join the Friends at
Virtually Yours: Relating and Reality in the Digital Age

During this three-day mini-seminar (January 15, 16, 17) we will explore the impact of social media and digital devices on our approach to identity, relationships, and reality. Topics will include generational differences and digital identity; friendships, love, loneliness, and loss; and navigating "rea" vs. "fake" in the digital age.
A complimentary lunch will be served at noon.
To register for this course, or for more information on the Friends of Sarah Lawrence College, please e-mail
